metadata.title: CVE-2020-36430 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
libass 0.15.x before 0.15.1 has a heap-based buffer overflow indecode_chars (called from decode_font and process_text) because the wronginteger data type is used for subtraction.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-36430` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libass9 - 1:0.15.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libass package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:0.15.2-1').
